intro: Lacinaria aspera, commonly known as the rough lacinaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves that are often lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Lacinaria aspera is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
